title: Vibha Masti
text:
personal mail
  
  
    
     college mail

     youtube
  
  
    
     github
  

  
  
Hi there üëã! I‚Äôm a senior undergraduate Computer Science and Engineering student at PES University, Bangalore. I am currently interning at Apple as a Machine Learning Engnieer.
My research interests lie in machine learning, natural language processing, and related fields. I have experience interning at Apple, Goldman Sachs, Netradyne, and Vogo. I have also worked on research projects in NLP, ML, Graph ML, Music IR, etc. You can find my detailed CV here.
I enjoy making concise, pictorial and aesthetically-pleasing lecture notes that my peers at college have been using to study since my first year (~38,000+ hits to the link). This really helped my juniors and peers during the pandemic as it was very difficult for everyone to keep up with all the online classes during such difficult times.
I learn to play the South-Indian instrument Saraswathi Veena in the Carnatic style. I also enjoy making YouTube videos about my experiences and interests. I have made videos about my college life, academic conferences, and more. You can find my YouTube channel here.

title: Vibha Masti
text:
News

2023

[01/09] üíª I started my 6-month spring internship/co-op at Apple! I am so excited for this experience and unbelievably grateful.



2022

[12/04] üé∂ I volunteered for the ISMIR 2022 conference in Bangalore, India from 4th to 9th December 2022.
[09/19] ‚úàÔ∏è I attended the ECML-PKDD 2022 conference in Grenoble, France from 19th to 23rd September with my teammates to present at the MLG workshop. I made a vlog about it here.
[07/01] ‚úàÔ∏è I traveled to Mumbai with my teammates to attend the IEEE TENSYMP conference and present our paper. I made a YouTube video about the experience here!
[06/06] üíª I started my summer internship at Goldman Sachs.
[06/03] üé¨ Made my first ever vlog! It‚Äôs about my 6th semester of college which was (finally) in-person!

title: UE19CS205 - Automata Formal Languages and Logic
text:
Course instructor: Prof.¬†Preet Kanwal


Syllabus and Class Notes



Unit
Syllabus
Vibha‚Äôs Notes




Unit 1
- Mathematical Preliminaries
- Basic Notations
- Deterministic Finite Acceptors (DFA)
- Non-Deterministic Finite Acceptors (NFA)
- \(\lambda\)-NFA (Lambda-NFA)
- Equivalence of Deterministic and Non-deterministic
Finite Acceptors
- Reduction of the number of states in Finite Automata
(Minimization of DFA)
AFLL Unit 1.pdf


Unit 2
- Regular Expressions
- Connection between Regular Expressions Regular Languages
- Regular Grammars
- Properties of Regular Languages
- Pumping Lemma and identifying Non‚ÄìRegular Languages
AFLL Unit 2.pdf


Unit 3
- Context Free Grammars
- Parsing and Ambiguity
- Formal Definitions of Pushdown Automata
- Deterministic Pushdown Automata
- Non Deterministic Pushdown Automata
- Methods for Transforming Grammars
- Two important Normal Forms
- A Membership Algorithm for Context‚ÄìFree Languages
- Pushdown down Automata and Context Free Languages
AFLL Unit 3.pdf


Unit 4
- Properties of Context‚ÄìFree Languages
- Pumping Lemma for Context‚ÄìFree Languages
- The Standard Turing Machine
- Combining Turing Machine for Complicated Tasks
- Turing Thesis
- Recursive and Recursively Enumerable Languages
- Context Sensitive Grammar and Languages
- The Chomsky Hierarchy
- Some Problems that Cannot be solved by Turing Machine
- PCP
- Undecidable Problems for Recursively Enumerable Languages
AFLL Unit 4.pdf


Unit 5
- Propositional Logic: A very simple logic
- Syntax
- Semantics
- A simple knowledge Base
- A simple Inference procedure
- Inferences and Proofs
- Proof by resolution
- First Order Logic: Syntax and Semantics of First
order logic
- Numbers, Sets and Lists
- Example - The electronic circuit Domain
AFLL Unit 5.pdf






Textbooks:

T1: ‚ÄúAn Introduction to Formal Languages and Automata‚Äù, Peter Linz, Jones and Bartlett, New Delhi, India, 5th Edition, 2011
T2: ‚ÄúArtificial Intelligence ‚Äì A Modern Approach‚Äù, Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig, Pearson, 3rd Edition (Paperback), 2016




Reference Books:

R1: ‚ÄúTheory of Computation‚Äù, Michael Sipser, Cengage Learning, New Delhi, India, 2008
R2: ‚ÄúIntroduction to Automata Theory, Languages, and Computation‚Äù, John E Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D Ullman, Pearson Education, New Delhi, India, 3rd Edition, 2009
R3: ‚ÄúTheory of Computation: A Problem‚ÄìSolving Approach‚Äù, Kavi Mahesh, Wiley India, New Delhi, 2012

title: UE19CS204 - Web Technologies
text:
Course instructor: Prof.¬†Vinay Joshi


Syllabus and Class Notes



Unit
Syllabus
Vibha‚Äôs Notes




Unit 1
- Introduction to WWW and Web protocols
- HTTP Request Response Formats
- URLs, Basic Markups & syntax
- HTML elements & attributes
- Web Form 2.0 and Form Controls
- CSS3.0-Styles and Style sheets
- Selectors, Style properties
- Box Model
- JavaScript Basics - (variables, scope and
lexical operator (fat arrow))
- JavaScript objects
Web Tech Unit 1.pdf


Unit 2
- RDOM Manipulations
- Events and Event Handling in JavaScript
- XML Vs JSON
- HTML5 (New Tags, New Inputs, Elements & API)
- JQuery Introduction
- Callbacks and Promises
- Single Page Application
- Asynchronous Communication
Web Tech Unit 2.pdf


Unit 3
- MERN Introduction
- React installation and application setup with web pack
- JSX
- React Classes and Components
- Rendering of elements
- Properties, State, Context
- Component lifecycle methods
- Refs & Keys
- Event Handling
- React Router
- Stateless components
- React Form & Controls
Web Tech Unit 3.pdf


Unit 4
- Understanding Node JS Architecture
- NPM Installation and Features
- Set up Node JS app
- HTTP Methods and Verbs
- Query String
- Callbacks, Buffers, Streams, File system
- MongoDB-Documents, Collections
- Reading and Writing to MongoDB, MongoDB NodeJS Driver
- Running a react application on NodeJS
Sorry, no notes üòï


Unit 5
- Introduction to Web services and REST APIs
- Express Installation and Server setup
- Building the application stack
- Routing, List API, Create API
- Error Handling
- Express Middleware, Express Scaffolding and Templates
Sorry, no notes üòï






Textbooks:

T1: ‚ÄúLearning PHP, MySQL & JavaScript‚Äù, Robin Nixon. May 2018, 5th edition, O‚ÄôReilly Media, Inc.
T2: ‚ÄúPro MERN Stack: Full Stack Web App Development with Mongo, Express, React, and Node‚Äù, by Vasan Subramanian. March 2017, Apress




Reference Books:

R1: ‚ÄúBeginning Node.js, Express & MongoDB Development‚Äù, Greg Lim, July 2019
R2: ‚ÄúLearning React, Functional Web Development with React and Redux‚Äù, Alex Banks and Eve Porcello, May 2017, O‚ÄôReilly Media, Inc.
